item.title: New Assassin's Creed "Leadership Team" Revealed by Ubisoft
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft has revealed who's going to be looking after the Assassin's Creed franchise from now on, and three figures with plenty of past experience with the series will be taking the reins.

The announcement, which was made via Reddit earlier today, names Martin Schelling as Assassin's Creed's new "Head of Brand". Schelling will "lead the franchise team, as well as the overall strategy", according to Ubisoft. He's previously served as producer on games like Black Flag and Valhalla.

Joining Schelling at the helm of Assassin's Creed is Jean Guesdon, who was creative director on both Black Flag and Origins. He'll now be serving as "Head of Content", which will see him leading the franchise's "creative direction" and shaping its future "while ensuring it remains true to its DNA".

The final new Assassin's Creed appointment is Francois de Billy, who will serve in the rather oddly-named role of "Head of Production Excellence".

Apparently, it'll be de Billy's responsibility to "strengthen production practices and execution across the franchise". He was Origins and Valhalla's Production Director, and he's also worked on "several major Assassin's Creed titles", including Black Flag and Revelations.

Between them, these three men will form Assassin's Creed's new franchise leadership team, and Ubisoft says they'll "bring their expertise, knowledge, and passion to guide Assassin's Creed into its next chapter".

News of this team's formation comes after longtime Assassin's Creed boss Marc-Alexis Côté departed Ubisoft back in October, with Côté subsequently suing Ubisoft to the tune of more than $1.3 million and claiming "constructive dismissal".

The news also comes after Ubisoft announced a major restructuring in January, resulting in the cancellation of the beleaguered Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time remake, as well as layoffs and voluntary redundancies at several studio locations.

We'll have to wait and see whether the new franchise leadership team can steer Assassin's Creed, and thus Ubisoft, towards the growth and profitability the company craves. Stay tuned for more.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
